meanings.definition: To ordain or admit to the priesthood.
meanings.sent1: The bishop priested the new priest during the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: She priested the young man, making him an official member of the clergy.
meanings.sent3: The cat priested the dog as the guardian of the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The sun priested the sky with its golden rays at dawn.
meanings.sent5: The wizard priested the magical staff, granting it extraordinary powers.

meanings.definition: To perform the duties or functions of a priest.
meanings.sent1: He priested at the church every Sunday, leading the congregation in prayer.
meanings.sent2: The priest priested the sacrament, blessing the bread and wine.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel priested over the nuts, ensuring they were stored safely for winter.
meanings.sent4: The moon priested over the night, casting a gentle glow on the sleeping world.
meanings.sent5: The chef priested over the kitchen, creating delicious meals for the guests.
